io.spine.core

Class Events

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.core.Events

  • public final class Events
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for working with Event objects.

      • getActor

        public static io.spine.core.UserId getActor(io.spine.core.EventContext context)
        Obtains the actor user ID from the passed EventContext.

        The 'actor' is the user responsible for producing the given event.

        It is obtained as follows:

        • For the events generated from commands, the actor context is taken from the enclosing command context.
        • For the event react chain, the command context of the topmost event is used.
        • For the imported events, the separate import context contains information about an actor.

        If the given event context contains no origin, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown as it contradicts the Spine validation rules.

      • getProducer

        public static java.lang.Object getProducer(io.spine.core.EventContext context)
        Obtains event producer ID from the passed EventContext.
        Parameters:
        context - the event context to to get the event producer ID
        Returns:
        the producer ID

      • getRootCommandId

        public static io.spine.core.CommandId getRootCommandId(io.spine.core.Event event)
        Obtains the ID of the root command, which lead to this event.

        In case the passed Event instance is a reaction to another Event, the identifier of the very first command in this chain is returned.

        Parameters:
        event - the event to get the root command ID for
        Returns:
        the root command ID

      • idStringifier

        public static io.spine.string.Stringifier<io.spine.core.EventId> idStringifier()
        Obtains the stringifier for event IDs.

        Throws:

      • isRejection

        public static boolean isRejection(io.spine.core.Event event)
        Checks whether or not the given event is a rejection event.
        Parameters:
        event - the event to check
        Returns:
        true if the given event is a rejection, false otherwise

      • nothing

        public static <M extends io.spine.base.EventMessage> java.lang.Iterable<M> nothing()
        Creates an empty Iterable over the messages of the type <M>.

        This method is useful for returning empty result from reacting methods.

        Type Parameters:
        M - the type of messages
        Returns:
        empty Iterable
